ray.misc

Class Image

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.misc.Image

  • public class Image
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic image class packs all the image data into a single array of floats.
    Author:
    arbree Aug 18, 2005 FloatRGBImage.java Copyright 2005 Program of Computer Graphics, Cornell University

      • addTextureLookup

        public void addTextureLookup(Color outColor,
                             double texX,
                             double texY)
        Looks up the color value at the given texture coordinates and adds that value to the given color.
        Parameters:
        outColor - output color to be added by the texture
        texX - coordinate x of texture
        texY - coordinate y of texture

      • asBufferedImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage asBufferedImage()
        Return a BufferedImage (Java's internal image format) version of this image. The returned image is backed by the same data as this image, so changes to that image will affect this image. This is needed to make the updates to the display window fast and for image IO. It is not recommended for other uses.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage representing the data in this image

      • createFromBufferedImage

        public static Image createFromBufferedImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage inImage)
        Creates an image using the data in the input bufferedImage. The resulting image has a copy of the data contained in inImage, as floats.
        Parameters:
        inImage - the bufferedImage data
        Returns:
        created image

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String fileName)
        Write this image to the filename. The output is always written as a PNG regardless of the extension on the filename given.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the output filename
